titleproper.value: Guide to the Virginia Jahn Peterson Collection <num>MC.328</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-08-29T20:27:10</date>

abstract.value: Virginia Jahn Peterson was a high school teacher who graduated from the New York University School of Education in 1944. This collection contains materials related to her time as a student at the New York University School of Education during the 1940s and as an alumna in the 1970s and 1980s. The collection includes a 1944 commencement ceremony program, class yearbook, NYU felt pennant and pin, and two issues of NYU Alumni publications.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Virginia Jahn Peterson Collection; MC 328; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Donated by Gayjone Carroll, May 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.087.
Virginia Jahn Peterson (1922-1997) was a high school teacher and national speed skating champaion. She graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree from the NYU School of Education in 1944.

This collection contains materials related to Virginia Jahn Peterson's time as a student at the New York University School of Education during the 1940s and as an alumna. The collection includes a 1944 commencement ceremony program, class yearbook, NYU felt pennant and pin, and two issues of NYU Alumni publications.

subject.value: Universities and Colleges -- Alumni and alumnae.

corpname.value: New York University. School of Education. Alumni Association
